DOC.brief_summary: This multicenter study will evaluate the correlation of interleukin 28B (IL28B) genotypes with disease characteristics and demographics in treatment-naïve and treatment-experienced chronic hepatitis C patients, including patients with HIV co-infection. There will be a single study visit for testing.
DOC.brief_title: A Study on the Correlation Between Interleukin 28B Genotypes With Clinical and Demographic Characteristics in Treatment-Naïve and Treatment-Experienced Patients With Chronic Hepatitis C
DOC.criteria: Adult (according to local legislation) male or female patient Chronic hepatitis C (CHC) Patients naïve to CHC treatment or patients who received prior interferonbased therapy for CHC for whom data on treatment received and treatment outcome is available; information on fibrosis stage prior to previous treatment is also required Coinfection with hepatitis B History or evidence of decompensated liver disease History of major organ transplantation with an existing functional graft (including liver transplantation) End stage renal disease
